sentence.text: Oculocutaneous albinism type 4 (OCA4) in humans and similar phenotypes in many animal species are caused by variants in the sucrose transport gene, encoding a putative sugar transporter.
In dog, two independent sucrose transport variants are known that cause oculocutaneous albinism in Doberman Pinschers and several small dog breeds respectively.
We therefore suggest that sucrose transport:c.1287delC causes the observed oculocutaneous albinism in the affected Bullmastiff
